div.l: A Ioly popper / bar he in his powche
Ther was no man / for pereil durst him touche
A sheffelde thwetyl / bar he in his hose
Rounde was his face / and camhed was his nose
As peled as an ape was his skulle
He was a marcat betere / at the fulle
Ther durst no wyht hond on him legge
That he ne swoor / he sholde a non a begge
A theef he was / for sothe of corne and mele
And that a slyh / and vsaunt for to stele
His name was / hoten deynous symkyn̄
A wyf he hadde / comen of noble kyn̄
The persoun / of the toune hir Fathir was
Wyth hir he yaf ful many a panne of bras
For that synkyn̄ shulde in his blood allye
She was Fostred in a nonnerye
For synkyn̄ wolde no wyf / as he saide
But she wer wel norshed and a mayde
To savyn̄ his astat of yemanrye
And she was prowde / and as pert as a pye
A ful faire syht was it on hem two
On halidaies beforne hir wolde he go
Wᵗyth his typet wounde a bout his hede
And she cam after / wᵗyth a gyte of red
AnsdAndAs symkyn̄ hadde hosyn̄ of the same
Ther durstyn̄ no wyht / callen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy / that went bi th way
That wᵗyth hir durst rage or play
But he wolde be slayn̄ / of denyous symkyn̄
Wᵗyth panade / wᵗyth knyf / or wᵗyth boidkyn̄
For Ielous folk / ben hardy evir mo
Algate they wolden her wyfuys wenden so
